content.rendered:
Eye Laser Treatment In Pune

Eye Laser Treatment In Pune is suitable for Above 18 years of age and those with stable refractive power, Stable vision (spectacles prescription ) for at least 1 year, Absence of other eye diseases, especially affecting the cornea, Not pregnant or breast-feeding., Patient with adequate corneal thickness and normal corneal curvature.This is measured with the help of special machines called pentacam.

Refractive Services
The human eye and refractive errors
The human eye is an optical marvel which functions similar to a camera.
When the eyes are not able to focus the light rays to the retina, eye sight is blurred and the condition is called a refractive error.
Refractive errors occur when the shape of the cornea,lens or the eye is abnormal.
There are different types of refractive errors:

What is Eye Laser Treatment In Pune or What is Advanced LASIK Surgery?

Advanced LASIK Surgery is a laser eye treatment designed specifically to treat individual vision errors, keeping in mind the fact that every patient’s eye differs in corneal thickness, shape and pupil size .

Eye Laser Treatment In Pune which helps patients get rid of glasses and contact lenses permanently.

It allows correction of myopia even up to -15.00D, hyperopia up to +8.00D and astigmatism of even up to 6.00D.
Apart from correcting refractive errors, it also corrects certain higher order aberrations.
As a part of the treatment,

  • Each eye will be examined for previously unseen details known as aberration
  •  A treatment that can correct individual visual errors and aberrations will be planned
  •  A combination of smaller and larger beams will deliver precise treatment which is unique to the patients eye

The laser surgery.(Eye Laser Treatment In Pune)

Before the Advanced LASIK Surgery is performed ,local anaesthetic drops are administered so that the treatment is completely painless.

The patient is made to lie down on a bed with their eyes open, facing up.
Using a precision device, a thin flap on the surface of the cornea is created.

The flap is gently lifted on one side, and the bed of the cornea (Stroma) is exposed and the laser is applied. After 30-40 sec, the flap is repositioned.
The surgery lasts for twenty minutes following which vision tests will be done and medications will be prescribed to avoid infection or dry eye.

Why have LASIK?

Everybody has a different reason for seeking refractive surgery but for all it is a choice for a new lifestyle. Whether it be for practical, professional, or sporting reasons, or for leisure activities, LASIK can open up a whole new world for you. You can realize your full potential with a clearer vision for the future.

The most common sight defects are:

· Myopia or nearsightedness,where closer objects are seen clearly
· Hyperopia or farsightedness, where far objects are seen clearly
· Astigmatism, where both near and far objects appear blurred
Refractive errors can be treated permanently by Advanced LASIK surgery.

Risk of LASIK

  •  Strict inclusion criteria for eligibility of LASIK patient selection is the key to success
  •  Optimum corneal thickness, curvature study gives us good idea about success of LASIK in a particular patient.
    So every eye is NOT suitable for LASIK. It might surprise you that we turn down many patients who come to us for this procedure because of irregularities in corneal architecture, Which makes the eye unsuitable for laser treatment.
  • Few things to remember if you are to undergo Advanced LASIK surgery:
    Please do not wear soft contact lenses for a week and rigid lenses two weeks before surgery
     Please do not use perfumes, make –ups or any sprays which may interfere with the pattern of the laser beam
  •  Please arrive on time and be prepared to stay for approximately 2-3 hours in the hospital
  •  If you have anxiety about your treatment ,our support staff will be happy to assist you in every way possible and make you feel relaxed and comfortable
  •  Our staff will give you personalized aftercare instructions and eye drops.
  •  Your vision may remain blurred for a few hours ,so please ensure that there is somebody to take you home
  •  Patient who undergo Advanced LASIK surgery can the day of treatment

Complications:
LASIK is a surgical procedure ,and has some associated risks you must be aware before proceeding .Fortunately, complications are very uncommon.
Improved technology has reduced the risks even further.

Alternatives to LASIK
If you are not suitable for LASIK then there may be other procedures, such as photorefractive keratectomy (PRK) or laser epithelial keratomileusis (LASEK) or phakic intraocular lens implants(IOL) or clear lens extraction (refractive lens exchange) with negative intraocular lens implantation ,that are appropriate and your surgeon will discuss these options with you.

Phakic IOLs are designed for people with high degrees of refractive errors which cannot be safely corrected with corneal-based refractive surgery. The phakic IOL, referred to as an implantable contact lens or ICL,is surgically implanted inside the ye in front of or behind the iris of the eye. The eyes natural (phakic )lens is not removed ,so patients can retain their pre-existing ability to focus.

Post-operative care:-

  • We do recommend to our patients to wear protective glasses supplied by the hospital and to avoid rubbing the eyes for a few days following the treatment.
  • The patients will be able to see better one to two hours after the surgery, but complete clarity is experienced the next day. However ,one should take care to give the eyes time for recovery.
  • It is advisable to rest the eyes for 2-3 days especially if the patients work involves using the computer.

Who is suitable for Advanced LASIK Surgery?

Advanced LASIK surgery is only for those
1. Above 18 years of age and those with stable refractive power
2. Stable vision (spectacles prescription ) for at least 1 year
3. Absence of other eye diseases, especially affecting the cornea
4. Not pregnant or breast-feeding.
5.Patient with adequate corneal thickness and normal corneal curvature.This is measured with the help of special machines called pentacam.

LASIK FAQs

How long does the surgery take?
As in most of the patient both eyes are treated in some sitting ,your procedure may last for 10 to 15 min
Is it painful?
No.surgery is carried out after putting anaesthetic drops. Some patient might feel pressure sensation for few minutes.
When can normal daily activity be resumed?
You can resume your activities in 3-4 days’ time. Tough water sport or swimming should be avoided for at least months.
Is repeat treatment required?
Up to 99% patients do not required any further procedure .In remaining few patients enhancement treatment might be required to achieve optimum vision.
Is treatment permanent?
Yes, however you might need reading glasses once you reach presbyopia age
Is LASIk safe?
LASIK is one of the safest surgeries in human body ,however as with any medical procedures there are certain risk involves Which a candidate may understand and accept before surgery. Please make sure you have discussed your case in detail with your surgeon and understood all aspects of the procedure.
